required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Open Label, Phase II Study to Evaluate Efficacy and Safety of Oral Nilotinib in Philadelphia Positive (Ph+) Chronic Myelogenous Leukemia (CML) Pediatric Patients.
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-center, Open Label, Non-controlled Phase II Study to Evaluate Efficacy and Safety of Oral Nilotinib in Pediatric Patients With Newly Diagnosed Ph+ Chronic Myelogenous Leukemia (CML) in Chronic Phase (CP) or With Ph+ CML in CP or Accelerated Phase (AP) Resistant or Intolerant to Either Imatinib or Dasatinib

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the safety, efficacy and pharmacokinetics of nilotinib over time in the Ph+ chronic myelogenous leukemia (CML) in pediatric patients (from 1 to <18 years).

detailed_description.textblock:
The study was designed as a multi-center, open-label, non-controlled phase II study to assess efficacy, safety and PK parameters of 230 mg/m2 twice daily nilotinib in pediatric patients (1 to <18 years old). The study population consisted of three cohorts of Ph+ CML pediatric patients:
- Cohort 1: Ph+ CML-CP patients resistant or intolerant to either imatinib or dasatinib
- Cohort 2: Ph+ CML-AP patients resistant or intolerant to either imatinib or dasatinib
- Cohort 3: Newly-diagnosed Ph+ CML-CP patients in first chronic phase A minimum number of 50 pediatric patients (from 1 to <18 years) were enrolled in the study. Of them, at least 15 patients were Ph+ CML-CP patients resistant or intolerant to either imatinib or dasatinib, and at least 15 were newly-diagnosed Ph+ CML-CP patients in first chronic phase patients. There was no minimum number of patients required for Ph+ CML-AP patients resistant or intolerant to either imatinib or dasatinib.
Based on enrollment forecasts as of Jan 2015, and to reflect the agreements with the US FDA and the PDCO, the study remained open for enrollment until the targeted number of 50 patients with at least 15 newly diagnosed Ph+CML patients was achieved or until 31May2015, whichever was later.
Patients who completed the study were treated with nilotinib for a total of 66 cycles of 28 days unless the patient prematurely discontinued study treatment.
The primary analysis cut-off date was the date when all patients enrolled in the trial either completed their visit for treatment cycle 12 or had discontinued study treatment early (EoT/early discontinuation visit). These analyses were reported in the 12-cycle clinical study report (CSR). A 24-cycle analysis was done when all patients had either completed their 24-cycle treatment visit or had discontinued study treatment early.
At trial end, a final comprehensive CSR of all data collected during the trial was produced.

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of Major Molecular Response (MMR) at 6 Cycles for Ph+ CML CP Patients Resistant or Intolerant to Imatinib or Dasatinib
primary_outcome.description: MMR is defined as ≤ 0.1% BCR-ABL/control gene (ABL) % by international scale, or equivalent to ≥ 3 log reduction of BCR-ABL transcript from standardized baseline, measured by RQ-PCR (Real time quantitative polymerase chain reaction). BCR-ABL is the fusion gene from breakpoint cluster region and Abelson genes. A patient was counted as having MMR at 6 cycles if the patient met the MMR criteria at the Cycle 6 Visit.

primary_outcome.measure: MMR Rate by 12 Cycles in Newly Diagnosed Ph+ CML-CP Patients
primary_outcome.description: MMR is defined as ≤ 0.1% BCR-ABL/control gene (ABL) % by international scale, or equivalent to ≥ 3 log reduction of BCR-ABL transcript from standardized baseline, measured by RQ-PCR (Real time quantitative polymerase chain reaction). BCR-ABL is the fusion gene from breakpoint cluster region and Abelson genes. A patient was counted as having MMR by 12 cycles if the patient met the MMR criteria at least once at any time between first study drug intake and Cycle 12 visit included.

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of Complete Cytogenic Response (CCyR) at 12 Cycles in Newly Diagnosed Ph+ CML-CP Patients
primary_outcome.description: Cytogenetic response is assessed as the percentage of Philadelphia positive (Ph+) metaphases in the bone marrow. Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR) is defined as 0% of Ph+ metaphases. A patient was counted as CCyR at 12 cycles if the patient met the CCyR criteria at the Cycle 12 Visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: MMR Rate by Time Points in Ph+ CML-CP Patients Resistant or Intolerant to Imatinib or Dasatinib
secondary_outcome.description: Major molecular response (MMR) was defined as BCR-ABL/ABL % ≤ 0.1% by IS as measured by RQ-PCR, confirmed by duplicate analysis of the same sample.

secondary_outcome.measure: MMR Rate by Time Points in Newly Diagnosed Ph+ CML-CP Patients
secondary_outcome.description: Major molecular response (MMR) was defined as BCR-ABL/ABL % ≤ 0.1% by IS as measured by RQ-PCR, confirmed by duplicate analysis of the same sample.

secondary_outcome.measure: Best BCR-ABL Ratio Categories for Resistant/Intolerant Ph+ CML - Overall
secondary_outcome.description: MMR is defined as ≤ 0.1% BCR-ABL/control gene (ABL) % by international scale, or equivalent to ≥ 3 log reduction of BCR-ABL transcript from standardized baseline, measured by RQ-PCR (Real time quantitative polymerase chain reaction). BCR-ABL is the fusion gene from breakpoint cluster region and Abelson genes. BCR-ABL ratio by percentage: > 0.0032 to ≤ 0.01% is equal to a log reduction category of >= 4 to <4.5 -log reduction (MR4); BCR-ABL ratio by percentage: <=0.0032% is equal to a log reduction category of >= 4.5-log reduction (MMR4.5)

secondary_outcome.measure: Best BCR-ABL Ratio Categories for Newly Diagnosed Ph+ CML-CP - Overall
secondary_outcome.description: MMR is defined as ≤ 0.1% BCR-ABL/control gene (ABL) % by international scale, or equivalent to ≥ 3 log reduction of BCR-ABL transcript from standardized baseline, measured by RQ-PCR (Real time quantitative polymerase chain reaction). BCR-ABL is the fusion gene from breakpoint cluster region and Abelson genes. BCR-ABL ratio by percentage: > 0.0032 to ≤ 0.01% is equal to a log reduction category of >= 4 to <4.5 -log reduction (MR4); BCR-ABL ratio by percentage: <=0.0032% is equal to a log reduction category of >= 4.5-log reduction (MMR4.5)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to First MMR Among Imatinib or Dasatinib Resistant or Intolerant CML-CP Patients Who Achieved MMR
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dosing to the first MMR within 66 cycles period
secondary_outcome.description: Time from first study drug intake to first MMR amongst imatinib or dasatinib resistant or intolerant patients with CML-CP computed only for patients who achieved MMR.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to First MMR Among Newly Diagnosed Ph+ CML-CP Patients Who Achieved MMR
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dosing to the first MMR within 66 cycles period
secondary_outcome.description: Time to MMR is the time from first study drug intake to first major molecular response computed only for participants who achieved MMR.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of First MMR Among Patients Who Were Resistant or Intolerant to Either Imatinib or Dasatinib Who Achieved MMR
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from MMR until confirmed loss of MMR (Assessed up to 66 cycles)
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of MMR is defined as the time between the date of the first MMR and the date of confirmed loss of MMR (i.e. the earliest of confirmed loss of MMR, CML-related death or progression to AP or BC). Participants without loss of MMR were censored at the last molecular assessment date.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of First MMR Among Newly Diagnosed Patients Who Achieved MMR
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from MMR until confirmed loss of MMR (Assessed up to 66 cycles)es)
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of MMR is defined as the time between the date of the first MMR and the date of confirmed loss of MMR (i.e. the earliest of confirmed loss of MMR, CML-related death or progression to AP or BC). Participants without loss of MMR were censored at the last molecular assessment date.

secondary_outcome.measure: Best Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR) Categories in Ph+ CML-CP Patients Resistant or Intolerant to Imatinib or Dasatinib - Overall
secondary_outcome.description: Complete cytogenetic response (CCyR) - 0% Ph+ metaphases Partial cytogenetic response (PCyR) - >0 to 35% Ph+ metaphases Minor cytogenetic response (mCyR) - >35 to 65% Ph+ metaphases Minimal - >65 to 95% Ph+ metaphases None - >95 to 100% Ph+ metaphases Major cytogenetic response (MCyR) - 0 to 35% Ph+ metaphases. A major response combines both complete and partial responses.

secondary_outcome.measure: Best Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR) in Newly Diagnosed Ph+ CML-CP Patients - Overall
secondary_outcome.description: Complete cytogenetic response (CCyR) - 0% Ph+ metaphases No response - >95 to 100% Ph+ metaphases

secondary_outcome.measure: Summary of Time to First Complete Cytogenic Response (CCyR) in Newly Diagnosed Ph+ CML-CP Patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dosing to the first CCyR up to 66 cycles
secondary_outcome.description: Cytogenetic response is assessed as the percentage of Philadelphia positive (Ph+) metaphases in the bone marrow. Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR) is defined as 0% of Ph+ metaphases. A patient was counted as having CCyR by 6 cycles (respectively 12 cycles) if the patient met the CCyR criteria at least once at any time between first study drug intake and cycle 6 (cycle 12 respectively) visit included.

secondary_outcome.measure: Kaplan-Meier Estimates of Time to First Complete Cytogenic Response (CCyR) in Newly Diagnosed Ph+ CML-CP Patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dosing to the first CCyR up to 66 cycles
secondary_outcome.description: Cytogenetic response is assessed as the percentage of Philadelphia positive (Ph+) metaphases in the bone marrow. Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR) is defined as 0% of Ph+ metaphases. A patient was counted as having CCyR by 6 cycles (respectively 12 cycles) if the patient met the CCyR criteria at least once at any time between first study drug intake and cycle 6 (cycle 12 respectively) visit included.

secondary_outcome.measure: Kaplan-Meier Estimates of Duration of First Complete Cytogenic Response (CCyR) Among Patients Who Achieved CCyR in Newly Diagnosed Ph+ CML-CP Patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From CCyR to loss of CCyR up to 66 cycles
secondary_outcome.description: Cytogenetic response is assessed as the percentage of Philadelphia positive (Ph+) metaphases in the bone marrow. Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR) is defined as 0% of Ph+ metaphases. A patient was counted as having CCyR by 6 cycles (respectively 12 cycles) if the patient met the CCyR criteria at least once at any time between first study drug intake and cycle 6 (cycle 12 respectively) visit included.

secondary_outcome.measure: Best Major Cytogenetic Response (MCyR) Rate by Time Point in Newly Diagnosed Ph+ CML Patients
secondary_outcome.description: Major cytogenetic response (MCyR) - 0 to 35% Ph+ metaphases. A major response combines both complete and partial responses.

secondary_outcome.measure: Summary of Time to First Major Cytogenetic Response (MCyR) Among Patients Who Achieved MCyR in Newly Diagnosed CML-CP Patients
secondary_outcome.description: Major cytogenetic response (MCyR) - 0 to 35% Ph+ metaphases. A major response combines both complete and partial responses.

secondary_outcome.measure: Kaplan-Meier Estimates of Time to First Major Cytogenetic Response (MCyR) in Newly Diagnosed CML-CP Patients
secondary_outcome.description: Major cytogenetic response (MCyR) - 0 to 35% Ph+ metaphases. A major response combines both complete and partial responses.

secondary_outcome.measure: Best Complete Hematological Response (CHR) by Time Point
secondary_outcome.description: Complete Hematological Response (CHR) was defined as WBC count <10×109/L platelet count <450×109/L basophils <5% no blasts and promyelocytes in peripheral blood myelocytes+metamyelocytes <5% in peripheral blood no evidence of extramedullary disease, including spleen and liver Assessment confirmation after at least 4 weeks for newly diagnosed Ph+ CML-CP

secondary_outcome.measure: Summary of Time to First Complete Hematological Response (CHR) Among Patients Who Achieved Confirmed CHR in Newly Diagnosed CML-CP Patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from first dosing to CHR, UP TO 66 CYCLES
secondary_outcome.description: Complete Hematological Response (CHR) was defined as WBC count <10×109/L platelet count <450×109/L basophils <5% no blasts and promyelocytes in peripheral blood myelocytes+metamyelocytes <5% in peripheral blood no evidence of extramedullary disease, including spleen and liver Assessment confirmation after at least 4 weeks for newly diagnosed Ph+ CML-CP

secondary_outcome.measure: Kaplan-Meier Estimates of Time to First Complete Hematological Response (CHR) in Newly Diagnosed CML-CP Patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from first dosing to CHR, UP TO 66 CYCLES
secondary_outcome.description: Complete Hematological Response (CHR) was defined as WBC count <10×109/L platelet count <450×109/L basophils <5% no blasts and promyelocytes in peripheral blood myelocytes+metamyelocytes <5% in peripheral blood no evidence of extramedullary disease, including spleen and liver Assessment confirmation after at least 4 weeks for newly diagnosed Ph+ CML-CP

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Disease Progression for Imatinib or Dasatinib Resistant or Intolerant CML-CP Patients - Kaplan-Meier Estimates
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dosing to the disease progression within 66 cycles
secondary_outcome.description: Time to disease progression is the time from the date of first study drug intake to the date of event defined as the first progression to AP or BC (from CP) or to BC (from AP) or the date of CML-related death occurring on treatment, whichever was earlier.

secondary_outcome.measure: Event Free Survival in Imatinib/Dasatinib Resistant/Intolerant CML-CP Patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dosing to the disease progression or death up to 66 cycles
secondary_outcome.description: Event Free Survival is defined as the time from the date of first study drug intake to the first occurrence of any of the following loss of CHR, loss of MCyR ( PCyR + CCyR), progression to AP/BC (from CP) or to BC (from AP), or death from any cause. (Including events only during treatment)

secondary_outcome.measure: Event Free Survival in Newly Diagnosed CML-CP Patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dosing to the disease progression or death up to 66 cycles
secondary_outcome.description: Event Free Survival is defined as the time from the date of first study drug intake to the first occurrence of any of the following loss of CHR, loss of MCyR ( PCyR + CCyR), progression to AP/BC (from CP) or to BC (from AP), or death from any cause. (Including events only during treatment)

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Survival (OS) in Imatinib/Dasatinib Resistant/Intolerant CML-CP - Kaplan-Meier Estimates
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from first dosing to death up to 66 cycles
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival is defined as the time from the date of first study drug intake to the date of death due to any cause. If a patient is not known to have died, survival will be censored at the date of their last assessment for patients on study and date of last contact for patients in follow-up.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Survival (OS) in Newly Diagnosed CML-CP Patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from first dosing to death up to 66 cycles
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival is defined as the time from the date of first study drug intake to the date of death due to any cause. If a patient is not known to have died, survival will be censored at the date of their last assessment for patients on study and date of last contact for patients in follow-up.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacodynamics (BCR-ABL Transcript Levels Determined With Standard Protocols in Peripheral Blood): Best MMR Status by Cycle
secondary_outcome.description: BCR-ABL is the fusion gene from breakpoint cluster region and Abelson genes. BCR-ABL transcript levels were summarized by cohort and time point. MMR is defined as ≤ 0.1% BCR-ABL/control gene (ABL) % by international scale, or equivalent to ≥ 3 log reduction of BCR-ABL transcript from standardized baseline, measured by RQ-PCR.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics (PK): Steady State Concentration of Nilotinib in Imatinib/Dasatinib Resistant/Intolerant CML-CP Patients
secondary_outcome.description: PK was analyzed only when all patients has completed 12 cycles on treatment or discontinued the study treatment early.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics: Steady State Concentration of Nilotinib in Newly Diagnosed CML-CP Patients
secondary_outcome.description: PK was analyzed only when all patients has completed 12 cycles of treatment or discontinued the study treatment early.

secondary_outcome.measure: Growth Data: Abnormal Height Standard Deviation Scores (SDS) Changes by Cohort
secondary_outcome.description: To assess long term effect on growth, development and maturation of nilotinib treatment in pediatric patients with Ph+ CML in participants with both a baseline and post-baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Acceptability (Including Palatability) of Dose Forms Used After First Dose, Cycle 1 and Cycle 12 Study Drug Formulation
secondary_outcome.description: Acceptability of the study drug was evaluated from a questionnaire completed by patients, with the help from parents or caregivers at visits. The Questionnaire to capture patient assessment of palatability (very good to very bad) and acceptability of taking the medication (very easy to very hard to administration).

secondary_outcome.measure: Mutational Assessment of BCR-ABL
secondary_outcome.description: Emerging signs of resistance to nilotinib

other_outcome.measure: Long Term Effect of Nilotinib on Bone Metabolism
other_outcome.description: The summary of bone age and Dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry (DEXA) by cohort. Alteration of bone biochemical markers of hand and wrist X-Ray evaluation was observed in bone age standard deviation scores (SDS) and for bone mineral density for DEXA before and after treatment with nilotinib.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Newly diagnosed and untreated Ph+ CML in first CP
arm_group.description: Diagnosis within 6 months of date of first cytogenetic analysis confirming Philadelphia chromosome with (9;22) translocation by standard conventional cytogenetic analysis.
Resistant or Intolerant to either imatinib or dasatinib
Resistant or intolerant to either imatinib or dasatinib - at the end no patients were enrolled in this arm.

intervention.description: Nilotinib supplied in 50mg, 150mg, and 200mg capsules. It was administered orally at 230mg/m2, twice daily for up to 66 cycles (1 cycle = 28 days). Dose administration was rounded to the nearest 50mg dose (to a maximum dose of 400mg).
intervention.arm_group_label: Newly diagnosed and untreated Ph+ CML in first CP

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- Newly diagnosed and untreated Ph+ CML CP or Ph+ CML CP or AP resistant or intolerant to either imatinib or dasatinib
- Karnofsky ≥ 50% for patients > 10 years of age and Lansky ≥ 50 for patients ≤ 10 years of age
- Adequate renal, hepatic and pancreatic function
- Potassium, magnesium, phosphorus and total calcium values ≥ LLN (lower limit of normal)
- Written informed consent
Key Exclusion Criteria:
- Treatment with strong CYP3A4 inhibitors or inducers
- Use or planned use of any medications that have a known risk or possible risk to prolong the QT interval
- Acute or chronic liver, pancreatic or severe renal disease
- History of pancreatitis or chronic pancreatitis.
- Impaired cardiac function
- No evidence of active graft vs host and <3mo since Stem Cell Transplant
- Total body irradiation (TBI) or craniospinal radiation therapy <6months
- Hypersensitivity to the active ingredient or any of the excipients including lactose.
- the criteria regarding pregnancy and contraception
- Active or systemic bacterial, fungal, or viral infection
- known Hepatitis B, Hepatitis C, or HIV infection

facility.name: Lucile Salter Packard Children's Hospital at Stanford
University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center Oncology

patient_data.ipd_description: Novartis is committed to sharing with qualified external researchers, access to patient-level data and supporting clinical documents from eligible studies. These requests are reviewed and approved by an independent review panel on the basis of scientific merit. All data provided is anonymized to respect the privacy of patients who have participated in the trial in line with applicable laws and regulations. This trial data availability is according to the criteria and process described on www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com

participant_flow.recruitment_details: 3 cohorts were planned based on disease classification. In 1 cohort no patients (pts) were enrolled so results presented are based on 2 cohorts. 34 imatinib/dasatinib resistant/intolerant CML-CP pts & 25 newly diagnosed CML-CP pts were enrolled. 1 imatinib/dasatinib resistant/intolerant pt did not receive study drug & was excluded from analysis.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Minimum 50 pediatric patients (pts) to be enrolled in the study. At least 15 were to be Ph+ CML-CP pts resistant/intolerant to either imatinib or dasatinib, & at least 15 newly diagnosed Ph+ CML-CP pts. There was no requirement on the minimum number of pts to be enrolled in the Cohort of CML-AP resistant/intolerant to either imatinib or dasatinib.

group.title: Resistant/Intolerant Ph+ CML in CP
group.description: Patients resistant or intolerant to either imatinib or dasatinib

group.title: Newly Diagnosed and Untreated Ph+ CML in First CP
group.description: Patients newly diagnosed in Chronic phase. Diagnosis within 6 months of date of first cytogenetic analysis confirming Philadelphia chromosome with (9;22) translocation by standard conventional cytogenetic analysis

participants_list.participants: Did not receive study drug due to adverse event (AE).

baseline.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): All patients who received at least one dose of study medication.

outcome.title: Rate of Major Molecular Response (MMR) at 6 Cycles for Ph+ CML CP Patients Resistant or Intolerant to Imatinib or Dasatinib
outcome.description: MMR is defined as ≤ 0.1% BCR-ABL/control gene (ABL) % by international scale, or equivalent to ≥ 3 log reduction of BCR-ABL transcript from standardized baseline, measured by RQ-PCR (Real time quantitative polymerase chain reaction). BCR-ABL is the fusion gene from breakpoint cluster region and Abelson genes. A patient was counted as having MMR at 6 cycles if the patient met the MMR criteria at the Cycle 6 Visit.

outcome.description: MMR is defined as ≤ 0.1% BCR-ABL/control gene (ABL) % by international scale, or equivalent to ≥ 3 log reduction of BCR-ABL transcript from standardized baseline, measured by RQ-PCR (Real time quantitative polymerase chain reaction). BCR-ABL is the fusion gene from breakpoint cluster region and Abelson genes. BCR-ABL ratio by percentage: > 0.0032 to ≤ 0.01% is equal to a log reduction category of >= 4 to <4.5 -log reduction (MR4); BCR-ABL ratio by percentage: <=0.0032% is equal to a log reduction category of >= 4.5-log reduction (MMR4.5)
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): All patients who received at least one dose of study medication

group.title: Newly Diagnosed and Untreated Ph+ CML in First CP
group.description: Patients newly diagnosed in Chronic phase. Diagnosis within 6 months of date of first cytogenetic analysis confirming Philadelphia chromosome with (9;22) translocation by standard conventional cytogenetic analysis.

measure.title: Best BCR-ABL Ratio Categories for Newly Diagnosed Ph+ CML-CP - Overall
measure.description: MMR is defined as ≤ 0.1% BCR-ABL/control gene (ABL) % by international scale, or equivalent to ≥ 3 log reduction of BCR-ABL transcript from standardized baseline, measured by RQ-PCR (Real time quantitative polymerase chain reaction). BCR-ABL is the fusion gene from breakpoint cluster region and Abelson genes. BCR-ABL ratio by percentage: > 0.0032 to ≤ 0.01% is equal to a log reduction category of >= 4 to <4.5 -log reduction (MR4); BCR-ABL ratio by percentage: <=0.0032% is equal to a log reduction category of >= 4.5-log reduction (MMR4.5)
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): All patients who received at least one dose of study medication

outcome.title: Time to First MMR Among Imatinib or Dasatinib Resistant or Intolerant CML-CP Patients Who Achieved MMR
outcome.description: Time from first study drug intake to first MMR amongst imatinib or dasatinib resistant or intolerant patients with CML-CP computed only for patients who achieved MMR.
outcome.time_frame: From first dosing to the first MMR within 66 cycles period
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): All patients who received at least one dose of study medication.

group.title: Resistant/Intolerant Ph+ CML in CP
group.description: Patients resistant or intolerant to either imatinib or dasatinib

measure.title: Time to First MMR Among Imatinib or Dasatinib Resistant or Intolerant CML-CP Patients Who Achieved MMR
measure.description: Time from first study drug intake to first MMR amongst imatinib or dasatinib resistant or intolerant patients with CML-CP computed only for patients who achieved MMR.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): All patients who received at least one dose of study medication.

outcome.title: Time to First MMR Among Newly Diagnosed Ph+ CML-CP Patients Who Achieved MMR
outcome.description: Time to MMR is the time from first study drug intake to first major molecular response computed only for participants who achieved MMR.
outcome.time_frame: From first dosing to the first MMR within 66 cycles period
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): All patients who received at least one dose of study medication.

group.title: Newly Diagnosed and Untreated Ph+ CML in First CP
group.description: Patients newly diagnosed in Chronic phase. Diagnosis within 6 months of date of first cytogenetic analysis confirming Philadelphia chromosome with (9;22) translocation by standard conventional cytogenetic analysis.

measure.title: Time to First MMR Among Newly Diagnosed Ph+ CML-CP Patients Who Achieved MMR
measure.description: Time to MMR is the time from first study drug intake to first major molecular response computed only for participants who achieved MMR.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): All patients who received at least one dose of study medication.

outcome.title: Duration of First MMR Among Patients Who Were Resistant or Intolerant to Either Imatinib or Dasatinib Who Achieved MMR
outcome.description: Duration of MMR is defined as the time between the date of the first MMR and the date of confirmed loss of MMR (i.e. the earliest of confirmed loss of MMR, CML-related death or progression to AP or BC). Participants without loss of MMR were censored at the last molecular assessment date.
outcome.time_frame: from MMR until confirmed loss of MMR (Assessed up to 66 cycles)
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): All patients who received at least one dose of study medication.

group.title: Resistant/Intolerant Ph+ CML in CP
group.description: Patients resistant or intolerant to either imatinib or dasatinib

measure.description: Duration of MMR is defined as the time between the date of the first MMR and the date of confirmed loss of MMR (i.e. the earliest of confirmed loss of MMR, CML-related death or progression to AP or BC). Participants without loss of MMR were censored at the last molecular assessment date.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): All patients who received at least one dose of study medication.

outcome.title: Best Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR) Categories in Ph+ CML-CP Patients Resistant or Intolerant to Imatinib or Dasatinib - Overall
outcome.description: Complete cytogenetic response (CCyR) - 0% Ph+ metaphases Partial cytogenetic response (PCyR) - >0 to 35% Ph+ metaphases Minor cytogenetic response (mCyR) - >35 to 65% Ph+ metaphases Minimal - >65 to 95% Ph+ metaphases None - >95 to 100% Ph+ metaphases Major cytogenetic response (MCyR) - 0 to 35% Ph+ metaphases. A major response combines both complete and partial responses.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): All patients who received at least one dose of study medication.

group.title: Resistant/Intolerant Ph+ CML in CP
group.description: Patients resistant or intolerant to either imatinib or dasatinib

measure.description: Complete cytogenetic response (CCyR) - 0% Ph+ metaphases Partial cytogenetic response (PCyR) - >0 to 35% Ph+ metaphases Minor cytogenetic response (mCyR) - >35 to 65% Ph+ metaphases Minimal - >65 to 95% Ph+ metaphases None - >95 to 100% Ph+ metaphases Major cytogenetic response (MCyR) - 0 to 35% Ph+ metaphases. A major response combines both complete and partial responses.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): All patients who received at least one dose of study medication.

outcome.description: Complete cytogenetic response (CCyR) - 0% Ph+ metaphases No response - >95 to 100% Ph+ metaphases
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): All patients who received at least one dose of study medication.

group.title: Newly Diagnosed and Untreated Ph+ CML in First CP
group.description: Patients newly diagnosed in Chronic phase. Diagnosis within 6 months of date of first cytogenetic analysis confirming Philadelphia chromosome with (9;22) translocation by standard conventional cytogenetic analysis.

measure.title: Best Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR) in Newly Diagnosed Ph+ CML-CP Patients - Overall
measure.description: Complete cytogenetic response (CCyR) - 0% Ph+ metaphases No response - >95 to 100% Ph+ metaphases
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): All patients who received at least one dose of study medication.

outcome.title: Summary of Time to First Complete Cytogenic Response (CCyR) in Newly Diagnosed Ph+ CML-CP Patients
outcome.description: Cytogenetic response is assessed as the percentage of Philadelphia positive (Ph+) metaphases in the bone marrow. Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR) is defined as 0% of Ph+ metaphases. A patient was counted as having CCyR by 6 cycles (respectively 12 cycles) if the patient met the CCyR criteria at least once at any time between first study drug intake and cycle 6 (cycle 12 respectively) visit included.
outcome.time_frame: From first dosing to the first CCyR up to 66 cycles
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): All patients who received at least one dose of study medication

group.title: Newly Diagnosed and Untreated Ph+ CML in First CP
group.description: Patients newly diagnosed in Chronic phase. Diagnosis within 6 months of date of first cytogenetic analysis confirming Philadelphia chromosome with (9;22) translocation by standard conventional cytogenetic analysis.

outcome.title: Best Complete Hematological Response (CHR) by Time Point
outcome.description: Complete Hematological Response (CHR) was defined as WBC count <10×109/L platelet count <450×109/L basophils <5% no blasts and promyelocytes in peripheral blood myelocytes+metamyelocytes <5% in peripheral blood no evidence of extramedullary disease, including spleen and liver Assessment confirmation after at least 4 weeks for newly diagnosed Ph+ CML-CP
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): All patients who received at least one dose of study medication

group.title: Newly Diagnosed and Untreated Ph+ CML in First CP
group.description: Patients newly diagnosed in Chronic phase. Diagnosis within 6 months of date of first cytogenetic analysis confirming Philadelphia chromosome with (9;22) translocation by standard conventional cytogenetic analysis.

outcome.title: Time to Disease Progression for Imatinib or Dasatinib Resistant or Intolerant CML-CP Patients - Kaplan-Meier Estimates
outcome.description: Time to disease progression is the time from the date of first study drug intake to the date of event defined as the first progression to AP or BC (from CP) or to BC (from AP) or the date of CML-related death occurring on treatment, whichever was earlier.
outcome.time_frame: From first dosing to the disease progression within 66 cycles
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): All patients who received at least one dose of study medication

group.title: Resistant/Intolerant Ph+ CML in CP
group.description: Patients resistant or intolerant to either imatinib or dasatinib

measure.title: Time to Disease Progression for Imatinib or Dasatinib Resistant or Intolerant CML-CP Patients - Kaplan-Meier Estimates
measure.description: Time to disease progression is the time from the date of first study drug intake to the date of event defined as the first progression to AP or BC (from CP) or to BC (from AP) or the date of CML-related death occurring on treatment, whichever was earlier.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): All patients who received at least one dose of study medication

measurement_list.measurement: NA = not estimable as there were not enough events

outcome.title: Event Free Survival in Imatinib/Dasatinib Resistant/Intolerant CML-CP Patients
outcome.description: Event Free Survival is defined as the time from the date of first study drug intake to the first occurrence of any of the following loss of CHR, loss of MCyR ( PCyR + CCyR), progression to AP/BC (from CP) or to BC (from AP), or death from any cause. (Including events only during treatment)
outcome.time_frame: From first dosing to the disease progression or death up to 66 cycles
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): All patients who received at least one dose of study medication

group.title: Resistant/Intolerant Ph+ CML in CP

outcome.title: Overall Survival (OS) in Imatinib/Dasatinib Resistant/Intolerant CML-CP - Kaplan-Meier Estimates
outcome.description: Overall survival is defined as the time from the date of first study drug intake to the date of death due to any cause. If a patient is not known to have died, survival will be censored at the date of their last assessment for patients on study and date of last contact for patients in follow-up.
outcome.time_frame: from first dosing to death up to 66 cycles
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): All patients who received at least one dose of study medication

outcome.title: Pharmacodynamics (BCR-ABL Transcript Levels Determined With Standard Protocols in Peripheral Blood): Best MMR Status by Cycle
outcome.description: BCR-ABL is the fusion gene from breakpoint cluster region and Abelson genes. BCR-ABL transcript levels were summarized by cohort and time point. MMR is defined as ≤ 0.1% BCR-ABL/control gene (ABL) % by international scale, or equivalent to ≥ 3 log reduction of BCR-ABL transcript from standardized baseline, measured by RQ-PCR.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): All patients who received at least one dose of study medication.

group.title: Resistant/Intolerant Ph+ CML in CP
group.description: Patients resistant or intolerant to either imatinib or dasatinib

group.description: Patients newly diagnosed in Chronic phase. Diagnosis within 6 months of date of first cytogenetic analysis confirming Philadelphia chromosome with (9;22) translocation by standard conventional cytogenetic analysis.

measure.title: Pharmacodynamics (BCR-ABL Transcript Levels Determined With Standard Protocols in Peripheral Blood): Best MMR Status by Cycle
measure.description: BCR-ABL is the fusion gene from breakpoint cluster region and Abelson genes. BCR-ABL transcript levels were summarized by cohort and time point. MMR is defined as ≤ 0.1% BCR-ABL/control gene (ABL) % by international scale, or equivalent to ≥ 3 log reduction of BCR-ABL transcript from standardized baseline, measured by RQ-PCR.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): All patients who received at least one dose of study medication.

outcome.title: Pharmacokinetics (PK): Steady State Concentration of Nilotinib in Imatinib/Dasatinib Resistant/Intolerant CML-CP Patients
outcome.description: PK was analyzed only when all patients has completed 12 cycles on treatment or discontinued the study treatment early.
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetics Analysis Set (PAS): All patients with at least one evaluable PK blood sample. Of the 32 patients included in the PAS, only 30 had evaluable Ctrough.

group.description: Patients resistant or intolerant to either imatinib or dasatinib

outcome.description: PK was analyzed only when all patients has completed 12 cycles of treatment or discontinued the study treatment early.
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetics Analysis Set (PAS): All patients with at least one evaluable PK blood sample.

outcome.title: Growth Data: Abnormal Height Standard Deviation Scores (SDS) Changes by Cohort
outcome.description: To assess long term effect on growth, development and maturation of nilotinib treatment in pediatric patients with Ph+ CML in participants with both a baseline and post-baseline value.
outcome.population: Safety Set (SAF): All patients who received at least one dose of study medication in participants with both a baseline and post-baseline value.

group.title: Resistant/Intolerant Ph+ CML in CP

measure.title: Growth Data: Abnormal Height Standard Deviation Scores (SDS) Changes by Cohort
measure.description: To assess long term effect on growth, development and maturation of nilotinib treatment in pediatric patients with Ph+ CML in participants with both a baseline and post-baseline value.
measure.population: Safety Set (SAF): All patients who received at least one dose of study medication in participants with both a baseline and post-baseline value.

class.title: Decrease from baseline of 1 SDS category (n=32,24)
Decrease from baseline of 2 SDS categories (n=32, 24)
Decrease from baseline of 3 SDS categories(n= 32, 24)

outcome.title: Acceptability (Including Palatability) of Dose Forms Used After First Dose, Cycle 1 and Cycle 12 Study Drug Formulation
outcome.description: Acceptability of the study drug was evaluated from a questionnaire completed by patients, with the help from parents or caregivers at visits. The Questionnaire to capture patient assessment of palatability (very good to very bad) and acceptability of taking the medication (very easy to very hard to administration).
outcome.population: Safety Set (SAF): All patients who received at least one dose of study medication.

group.title: All Patients
group.description: All patients enrolled in the study

outcome.title: Long Term Effect of Nilotinib on Bone Metabolism
outcome.description: The summary of bone age and Dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry (DEXA) by cohort. Alteration of bone biochemical markers of hand and wrist X-Ray evaluation was observed in bone age standard deviation scores (SDS) and for bone mineral density for DEXA before and after treatment with nilotinib.
outcome.population: Safety Set (SAF): All patients who received at least one dose of study medication.

outcome.title: All Collected Deaths
outcome.description: On treatment deaths were collected from FPFT up to 30 days after study drug discontinuation, for a maximum duration of 64.5 months (treatment duration ranged from 0.7 to 63.5 months). Deaths post treatment survival follow up were collected after the on- treatment period, up to approx. 7 years.
outcome.population: Clinical Database Population: All treated participants.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The terms and conditions of Novartis' agreements with its investigators may vary. However, Novartis does not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Any publications from a single-site are postponed until the publication of pooled data (i.e.,data from all sites) in clinical trial or disclosure of trial results in their entirety.
